text: Andreas Ibertsberger (born 27 July 1982) was an Austrian professional footballer. He played as a left-back. He was a member of the Austria national team. Ibertsberger is a younger brother of former national team player Robert Ibertsberger. ==Club career== He started his career with his local club SV Seekirchen. Then he went on to SV Austria Salzburg. In January 2005 he went on to SC Freiburg. In January 2008 he moved to 1899 Hoffenheim. With Hoffenheim he was promoted to the German Bundesliga. On 15 May 2012 the contract expired. He had missed most matches of the 2011â€“12 season with a chronic back problem. 2013 he went to MSV Duisburg in the 2.League. After this he ended his career. ==International career== Ibertsberger made his debut for Austria in an October 2004 World Cup qualification match against Northern Ireland. ==Managing career== He started as assistance coach for the second team of TSG Hoffenheim. Then he went on to Eintracht Frankfurt, where he is assistance coach of the U19 team.https://www.transfermarkt.at Andreas Ibertsberger profile in German ==References== ==Other websites== * * * * German Bundesliga stats at Fussballportal * Andreas Ibertsberger at the Austrian Official FA Website Category:1982 births Category:Living people Category:Austrian football managers Category:Austrian footballers Category:FC Red Bull Salzburg players Category:Players of the Austrian national football team Category:Austrian football defenders
title: Andreas Ibertsberger
